This new workflow automates the process of clearing the lock on a specific branch. It sets up the necessary environment, caches the Next.js build, installs dependencies using pnpm, and deploys to AWS with SST. This streamlines the deployment process and ensures that the application can be easily updated and maintained in the staging environment.

Support "link" style dependencies in Go tests (#4063)

The integration test framework currently supports using `dep` for dependency management.

However, `dep` has no native ability to manage "yarn link"-style dependencies on locally available packages.

This is a necessary scenario for testing in most repos though, as (e.g.) examples in the Kubernetes repo need to test against the locally available version of `pulumi-kubernetes`.

The best we can do is a trick of (a) deleting the vendored copy of the locally available dependency (b) copying the locally available dependency into the vendor folder (c) deleting the nested vendor folder in the new copy of the locally available dependency.

commit.message:
build(deps): update atuinsh/atuin to v18.4.0

This MR contains the following updates:

| Package | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|
| [atuinsh/atuin](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin) | minor | `v18.3.0` -> `v18.4.0` |

MR created with the help of [el-capitano/tools/renovate-bot](https://gitlab.com/el-capitano/tools/renovate-bot).

**Proposed changes to behavior should be submitted there as MRs.**

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>atuinsh/atuin (atuinsh/atuin)</summary>

### [`v18.4.0`](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/releases/tag/v18.4.0)

[Compare Source](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/compare/v18.3.0...v18.4.0)

#### Theme system

Thanks to [@​philtweir](https://github.com/philtweir), we now have a theming system! It's too much to write about here, so see the section in the docs: https://docs.atuin.sh/guide/theming/

#### Default changes

With this release, some defaults have changed. The most obvious will likely be the switch to the compact UI style + inline rendering

This can be reverted by setting

    style = "full"
    inline_height = 0

Read more here: https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2249

#### `atuin wrapped`

See your stats for 2024 with `atuin wrapped`

![CleanShot 2024-12-27 at 17 10 45@​2x](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c7853c47-4e3e-49c7-b811-c0a62ab8c259)

#### Build changes

Thanks to [@​senekor](https://github.com/senekor), we no longer require protoc available at build time, and instead use `protox`

##### Bug Fixes

-   *(crate)* Add missing description ([#​2106](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2106))
-   *(crate)* Add description to daemon crate ([#​2107](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2107))
-   *(daemon)* Add context to error when unable to connect ([#​2394](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2394))
-   *(deps)* Pin tiny_bip to 1.0.0 until breaking change resolved ([#​2412](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2412))
-   *(docker)* Update Dockerfile ([#​2369](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2369))
-   *(history)* Logic for store_failed=false ([#​2284](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2284))
-   *(mail)* Incorrect alias and error logs ([#​2346](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2346))
-   *(mail)* Enable correct tls features for postmark client ([#​2347](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2347))
-   *(theme)* Restore original colours ([#​2339](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2339))
-   *(themes)* Restore default theme, refactor ([#​2294](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2294))
-   *(tui)* Press ctrl-a twice should jump to beginning of line ([#​2246](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2246))
-   *(tui)* Don't panic when search result is empty and up is pressed ([#​2395](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2395))
-   Cargo binstall config ([#​2112](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2112))
-   Unitless sync_frequence = 0 not parsed by humantime ([#​2154](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2154))
-   Some --help comments didn't show properly ([#​2176](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2176))
-   Ensure we cleanup all tables when deleting ([#​2191](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2191))
-   Add idx cache unique index ([#​2226](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2226))
-   Idx cache inconsistency ([#​2231](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2231))
-   Ambiguous column name ([#​2232](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2232))
-   Atuin-daemon optional dependency ([#​2306](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2306))
-   Windows build error ([#​2321](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2321))
-   Codespell config still references the ui ([#​2330](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/issues/2330))

#### Verifying GitHub Artifact Attestations

The artifacts in this release have attestations generated with GitHub Artifact Attestations. These can be verified by using the [GitHub CLI](https://cli.github.com/manual/gh_attestation_verify):

```sh
gh attestation verify <file-path of downloaded artifact> --repo atuinsh/atuin
```

You can also download the attestation from [GitHub](https://github.com/atuinsh/atuin/attestations) and verify against that directly:

```sh
gh attestation verify <file-path of downloaded artifact> --bundle <file-path of downloaded attestation>
```

commit.message:
Merge #11767 #11774

11767: Pull NewPromptingPassphraseSecretsManager out of filestate r=Frassle a=Frassle

Baby steps to try and clean up the secret management code to enable both project secrets and secret plugins. Step 1 is trying to decouple the secret providers and backends. Step 1 of that is the simple case of just not having any passphrase code in the filestate module.

I also renamed "filestate.NewPassphraseSecretsManager" to "passphrase.NewPromptingPassphraseSecretsManager" to make it clear that this will invoke prompts (matches the naming style of the other methods in passphrase).

11774: Pull NewServiceSecretsManager out of httpstate r=Frassle a=Frassle

A sister PR to https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi/pull/11767. This pulls as much of NewServiceSecretsManager out of httpstate and to the secrets/service module.

What's left in httpstate is the DefaultSecretManager method pulling off the client and stack identifier to pass to NewServiceSecretsManager. That couldn't be done in secrets/service because that would cause a dependency chain loop (secrets/service would depend on the httpstate.Stack, but that would depend on secrets/service).

Arguably the `client.Client` ought to just be a string URL and the secret manager should make it's own client (like it does in NewServiceSecretsManagerFromState). But trying to keep each individual change here small.

Co-authored-by: Fraser Waters <fraser@pulumi.com>

commit.message:
Add kube-vip infrastructure (#107)

* Change make target

* Install kubernetes package

* Add kubernetes package to SDKs

* Regen schema

* Regen SDKs

* Patch schema types script

* More schemagen utility functions

* Regen schema

* Regen schema types

* Add PodManifest type

* Regen SDKs

* Add function to codegen

* Regen schema

* Regen schema types

* Regen SDKs

* WIP implementing

* Fix make generate deps

* Add bgp args

* Regen schema

* Regen schema types

* Regen SDKs

* Implementing bgp props

* More fixing make deps

* Add kubeVip to config exports and update function references ðŸš€

- Added export for 'kubeVip' in config
- Updated function references to use 'config' instead of specific path

* Added kubeVipJson to Node.js tests

In this update, we've extended the Node.js test suite by adding a new assertion for 'kubeVipJson'. We've also imported a function from the configuration file and used it to create 'kubeVip', which is then exported as 'kubeVipJson'. This ensures that our tests now cover this additional output.

* Add a pseudo resource for the manifest

* Change make deps again

Idk why this is weird

* Regen schema

* Regen schema types

* Regen SDKs

* Renamed file and updated default image version

The filename has been changed to better reflect its purpose. Additionally, the default version for the 'kube-vip' image has been set to '0.7.2' in case no specific version is provided.

* Refactor KubeVip to KubeVipManifest

The code changes involve refactoring the 'kubeVip' module to 'kubeVipManifest'. A new file, 'getKubeVipManifest.ts', has been added and is now being exported from the index. The class 'KubeVipManifest' has been created in the new file, which extends schema.KubeVipManifest. This class is also registered as a resource constructor in resources.ts. Corresponding updates have been made in tsconfig.json to reflect these changes.

* Updated test assertions and KubeVipManifest usage

The Node.js test file has been updated to assert that the 'kubeVipJson' output is not empty. In addition, the way we handle 'KubeVipManifest' in our TypeScript example has been modified. Instead of using a function to get its output, we now create a new instance of it and access its result property for JSON stringification.

* Enhanced kube-vip manifest generation

The kube-vip manifest generation function has been updated to include a yaml representation of the manifest. This new output is also added to the list of required outputs. The maps package was imported for cloning purposes.

* Updated schema with YAML representation

The schema for the Kubernetes resource has been updated to include a new property, 'yaml'. This is a string type and represents the yaml version of the manifest. The 'result' and 'yaml' properties are now required.

* Added yaml property to KubeVipManifest class

The KubeVipManifest class now includes a 'yaml' property. This change allows for more flexibility when handling Kubernetes configurations, as it provides an additional output option. The constructor has been updated accordingly to initialize this new property.

* Added YAML representation output to KubeVipManifest

In this update, a new output property for the YAML representation of the manifest has been added to the KubeVipManifest class across multiple SDKs (Dotnet, Go, Java, Node.js, and Python). This allows users to access the YAML format of the Kubernetes manifest directly from the KubeVipManifest object.

* Updated KubeVipManifest class

Added YAML import and applied stringify method to the result in the KubeVipManifest class. Also, updated registerOutputs to include yaml.

* Updated Kubernetes manifest generation

Added explicit definitions for apiVersion, kind, and metadata in the PodManifestInputs object. This change ensures correct values are set for these fields when generating Kubernetes manifests.

* Updated output format for kubeVip

The output format for kubeVip has been changed from JSON to YAML in both the test assertions and the export statement. This change ensures consistency across all outputs and improves readability.

* Added new parameters to static pod configuration

Two new parameters, 'name' and 'namespace', have been added to the static pod configuration. The 'name' parameter defaults to 'kube-vip', while the 'namespace' parameter defaults to 'kube-system'. These additions allow for more flexibility when configuring static pods.

* Added default values for static pod

Two new fields, 'name' and 'namespace', have been added to the schema.json file. These fields are used to specify the name and namespace of a static pod. Default values have been provided for both - 'kube-vip' for name and 'kube-system' for namespace.

* Added new optional fields to interfaces

Two new optional fields, 'name' and 'namespace', have been added to the KubeVipManifestArgs and getKubeVipManifestInputs interfaces. These changes allow for more flexibility when defining Kubernetes resources.

* Added static pod name and namespace

Enhanced the Kubernetes configuration by adding two new properties: 'name' and 'namespace'. These properties represent the name of the static pod and its namespace respectively. Default values have been set for both ('kube-vip' for name, 'kube-system' for namespace). Changes span across multiple files in different languages (C#, Go, Java, TypeScript, Python) ensuring consistency across all SDKs.

* Updated pod metadata in Kubernetes config

The pod metadata in the Kubernetes configuration has been updated to be more dynamic. The 'name' and 'namespace' fields now accept input values, with a fallback to default values if no input is provided.

* Added static pod generation functionality

A new function, generateStaticPod, has been added to the remote.go file. This function creates a static pod manifest on a remote system. It takes in parameters such as connection details, filename and pod manifest and returns outputs like the remote manifest file and its path. The changes also include adding 'StaticPod' to the list of commands that can be generated remotely.

* Added StaticPod component to schema

This update introduces a new "StaticPod" component in the Kubernetes schema. This component allows for the creation of a static pod manifest on a remote system. It includes properties such as connection parameters, file details, and pod manifest. Both inputProperties and requiredInputs have been defined for this new component.

* Added StaticPod class and interface

A new abstract class 'StaticPod' has been added to the schema-types file. This class extends from pulumi.ComponentResource and includes properties for connection, file, fileName, path, and pod. A constructor is also defined within this class. Additionally, a new interface 'StaticPodArgs' has been introduced which outlines the required inputs for creating a StaticPod instance.

* Added PodManifestArgs and StaticPod classes in .NET SDK. Updated Go SDK with PodManifestInput and PodManifestArgs types. These changes allow for the creation of a static pod manifest on a remote system, including setting connection parameters, file name, and pod manifest details.

* Added StaticPod class and its integration

A new class, StaticPod, has been added to handle static pod configurations. This includes the creation of a new file 'staticPod.ts' and exporting it in 'index.ts'. The StaticPod class is also integrated into the resources schema in 'resources.ts'. Additionally, the path to 'staticPod.ts' has been included in 'tsconfig.json' for TypeScript compilation.

* Added StaticPod to remote-ts

The import statement in the remote-ts file has been updated to include StaticPod. A new instance of StaticPod has also been created, with connection details and pod specifications defined. This addition expands the functionality of the remote test setup by allowing static pods.

* Added mkdir operation to static pod generation

The code changes introduce a new 'mkdir' operation in the function generateStaticPod. This operation ensures that the directory /etc/kubernetes/manifests exists. The 'mkdir' operation has been added to the list of required fields for this function as well.

* Updated schema.json with mkdir operation

The schema.json file has been updated to include a new "mkdir" operation. This addition ensures the existence of /etc/kubernetes/manifests on the remote system. The "mkdir" operation is now also included in the required fields list.

* Added mkdir to StaticPod class

The StaticPod class in the Kubernetes provider now includes a new property, mkdir. This addition allows for directory creation within the context of a static pod. The constructor has been updated accordingly to handle this new property.

* Added mkdir operation to StaticPod

The code changes introduce a new mkdir operation in the StaticPod class across multiple languages (Dotnet, Go, Java, Nodejs, Python). This operation ensures that the directory /etc/kubernetes/manifests exists. The changes include adding new properties and methods related to this operation.

* Updated staticPod.ts for better file management

Added a new directory constant and used it in the path interpolation. Introduced 'Mkdir' from tools to create directories if they don't exist. Made 'file' dependent on 'mkdir', ensuring the directory is created before attempting to write the file. Also, added 'mkdir' to registered outputs.

* Updated remote test setup

The staticPod instantiation in the remote test setup has been commented out due to permission issues with /etc/kubernetes/manifests. This change is temporary until a solution for the permissions issue is found.

* Updated Makefile dependencies

The Makefile has been updated to reflect changes in the dependency structure. The schema file location has been changed from a global variable to a more specific path within the provider command directory. This change affects various targets including local provider filename, different OS providers, and SDK generation for Java, Node.js, Python, Dotnet and Go.

commit.message:
Lift snapshot management out of the engine and serialize writes to snapshot (#1069)

* Lift snapshot management out of the engine

This PR is a prerequisite for parallelism by addressing a major problem
that the engine has to deal with when performing parallel resource
construction: parallel mutation of the global snapshot. This PR adds
a `SnapshotManager` type that is responsible for maintaining and
persisting the current resource snapshot. It serializes all reads and
writes to the global snapshot and persists the snapshot to persistent
storage upon every write.

As a side-effect of this, the core engine no longer needs to know about
snapshot management at all; all snapshot operations can be handled as
callbacks on deployment events. This will greatly simplify the
parallelization of the core engine.

Worth noting is that the core engine will still need to be able to read
the current snapshot, since it is interested in the dependency graphs
contained within. The full implications of that are out of scope of this
PR.

Remove dead code, Steps no longer need a reference to the plan iterator that created them

Fixing various issues that arise when bringing up pulumi-aws

Line length broke the build

Code review: remove dead field, fix yaml name error

Rebase against master, provide implementation of StackPersister for cloud backend

Code review feedback: comments on MutationStatus, style in snapshot.go

Code review feedback: move SnapshotManager to pkg/backend, change engine to use an interface SnapshotManager

Code review feedback: use a channel for synchronization

Add a comment and a new test

* Maintain two checkpoints, an immutable base and a mutable delta, and
periodically merge the two to produce snapshots

* Add a lot of tests - covers all of the non-error paths of BeginMutation and End

* Fix a test resource provider

* Add a few tests, fix a few issues

* Rebase against master, fixed merge

<details>
<summary>zellij-org/zellij</summary>

###
[`v0.36.0`](https://togithub.com/zellij-org/zellij/releases/tag/v0.36.0)

[Compare
Source](https://togithub.com/zellij-org/zellij/compare/v0.35.2...v0.36.0)

This release includes some nice quality-of-life features, as well as
some bug fixes.

#### Highlights

- It's now possible to hide the session name in the UI (check out:
https://zellij.dev/documentation/options.html#hide_session_name)
- A new bindable key action was added to clear the scrollbuffer of the
focused pane (check out `ClearScreen` here:
https://zellij.dev/documentation/keybindings-possible-actions.html)
-   Plugins are now loaded asynchronously

#### All changes

- add my tweaked theme by
[@​alekspickle](https://togithub.com/alekspickle) in
[https://github.com/zellij-org/zellij/pull/2257](https://togithub.com/zellij-org/zellij/pull/2257)
- fix(screen): focus pane on screen edge when moving pane focus offtab
by [@​imsnif](https://togithub.com/imsnif) in
[https://github.com/zellij-org/zellij/pull/2293](https://togithub.com/zellij-org/zellij/pull/2293)
- Correct summary by [@​Silejonu](https://togithub.com/Silejonu)
in
[https://github.com/zellij-org/zellij/pull/2235](https://togithub.com/zellij-org/zellij/pull/2235)
- Updated layout examples to .kdl from .yaml by
[@​caleflat](https://togithub.com/caleflat) in
